Title: Import of Animal Feed for Food-Producing Animals
Section: 
Subsection: None
Description: Businesses that want to import animal feed for food-producing animals (e.g. live chickens and fish) must register with SFA and obtain a Cargo Clearance Permit (CCP) issued by Singapore Customs for each consignment.
URL: https://www.sfa.gov.sg/food-import-export/commercial-imports/what-you-need-to-know-for-import-of-animal-feed

Title: Export / Tranship of Animal Feed for Food-Producing Animals
Section: 
Subsection: Licence, Permit & Registration
Description: Businesses that want to export or tranship animal feed for food-producing animals must have a Cargo Clearance Permit (CCP) for each consignment. Animal feed for non-food-producing animals is regulated by NParks.

To import, export, or tranship animal feed, you need to fulfil some general requirements. For instance, registration with ACRA is mandatory, and your UEN must be activated with Customs. In addition, if the animal feed that you intend to export/tranship is regulated by SFA, you must set up a GIRO arrangement with SFA. URL: https://www.sfa.gov.sg/commercial-exports/what-you-need-to-know-for-export-tranship-of-animal-feed

Title: Licence for Import/Export/Transhipment of Meat and Fish Products
Section: 
Subsection: None
Description: LICENCE FOR IMPORT/EXPORT/ TRANSSHIPMENT OF MEAT AND FISH PRODUCTS is required if Traders involved in the import/export/transshipment of meat and fish products. URL: https://www.gobusiness.gov.sg/browse-all-licences/singapore-food-agency-(sfa)/licence-for-import-export-transhipment-of-meat-and-fish-products

Title: Licence for Import/Transhipment of Fresh Fruits and Vegetables
Section: 
Subsection: None
Description: LICENSE FOR IMPORT/TRANSSHIPMENT OF FRESH FRUITS AND VEGETABLES is required if Traders involved in the import/transshipment of fresh fruits and vegetables. URL: https://www.gobusiness.gov.sg/browse-all-licences/singapore-food-agency-(sfa)/licence-for-import-transhipment-of-fresh-fruits-and-vegetables

Title: Licence to Import Poultry
Section: 
Subsection: None
Description: The Licence to Import Poultry is issued to importers by Singapore Food Agency to import Broiler Chickens and Broiler Ducks. URL: https://www.gobusiness.gov.sg/browse-all-licences/singapore-food-agency-(sfa)/licence-to-import-poultry

Title: Licence to Import Sheep & Goats
Section: 
Subsection: None
Description: The Licence to Import Sheep and Goats is issued to importers by Singapore Food Agency to import Sheep and Goats. URL: https://www.gobusiness.gov.sg/browse-all-licences/Singapore-Food-Agency-(SFA)/Licence-to-Import-Sheep-&-Goats

Title: Licence to Import Table Eggs
Section: 
Subsection: None
Description: The Licence to Import Table Eggs is issued to importers by Singapore Food Agency to import Table Eggs. URL: https://www.gobusiness.gov.sg/browse-all-licences/Singapore-Food-Agency-(SFA)/Licence-to-Import-Table-Eggs

Title: Licence to Import/Export/Tranship Food Animals, Birds, Eggs and Biologics
Section: 
Subsection: None
Description: The Licence to Import/Export/Transship Animals, Birds, Eggs and Biologics is issued by Singapore Food Agency. This licence is required if you intend to import/export/tranship animals, birds or their products into/out from Singapore.
URL: https://www.gobusiness.gov.sg/browse-all-licences/Singapore-Food-Agency-(SFA)/licence-to-import-export-tranship-food-animals--birds--eggs-and-biologics

Title: Registration to Import Animal Feed
Section: 
Subsection: None
Description: The Registration to Import Animal Feed may be issued by either Animal & Veterinary Service, a cluster of National Parks Board or Singapore Food Agency. This registration is issued to importers to import animal feed.
URL: https://www.gobusiness.gov.sg/browse-all-licences/Singapore-Food-Agency-(SFA)/Registration-to-Import-Animal-Feed

Title: Registration to Import Feed for Food Producing Animals
Section: 
Subsection: None
Description: The Registration to Import Feed for Food Producing Animals is issued by Singapore Food Agency. This registration is issued to importers to import animal feed.
URL: https://www.gobusiness.gov.sg/browse-all-licences/Singapore-Food-Agency-(SFA)/Registration-to-Import-Feed-for-Food-Producing-Animals

Title: Registration to Import Processed Food Products and Food Appliances
Section: 
Subsection: None
Description: Registration to Import Processed Food Products and Food Appliances is required if Traders involve in the import of processed food (not containing meat and fish products, fresh fruits and vegetables) and food appliances. URL: https://www.gobusiness.gov.sg/browse-all-licences/Singapore-Food-Agency-(SFA)/Registration-to-Import-Processed-Food-Products-and-Food-Appliances

Title: Registration to Import Live Frogs for Human Consumption
Section: 
Subsection: None
Description: The Registration to Import Live Frogs for Human Consumption is issued by Singapore Food Agency. This registration is issued to importers to import live frogs intended for human consumption.
URL: https://www.gobusiness.gov.sg/browse-all-licences/Singapore-Food-Agency-(SFA)/Registration-to-Import-Live-Frogs-for-Human-Consumption

Title: Rice Licence
Section: 
Subsection: None
Description: A licence issued by the Singapore Food Agency (SFA) is required to import (into Singapore or Singapore Free Trade Zone), export and carry out wholesale dealings in rice. URL: https://www.gobusiness.gov.sg/browse-all-licences/Singapore-Food-Agency-(SFA)/Rice-Licence

Title: Requirements for Food Shop Licences
Section: 
Subsection: Requirements for Licence / Permit for Food Retail
Description: Food Shops include bakeries, restaurants, food vending machines, canteens, coffee shops, eating houses, food courts, standalone kiosks, takeaway food carts, and private canteens/markets. The requirements and conditions for Food Shop Licences can be found in the Food Shop Self-Checklist.
URL: https://www.sfa.gov.sg/food-retail/licence-permit/requirements-for-licence-permit-for-food-retail

Title: Requirements for Supermarket Licences
Section: 
Subsection: Requirements for Supermarket Licences
Description: Supermarkets that sell raw meat or seafood, or conduct on-site preparation of food for sale require a SFA licence to operate. Retailers that solely sell pre-packed food do not require SFA food retail licences.
URL: https://www.sfa.gov.sg/food-retail/licence-permit/requirements-for-supermarket-licences

Title: Requirements for Temporary Fair Permits
Section: 
Subsection: Requirements for Temporary Fair Permits
Description: To operate Temporary Fairs, you must have a permit from SFA. Operating without a valid permit is an offence.
URL: https://www.sfa.gov.sg/food-retail/licence-permit/requirements-for-temporary-fair-permits

Title: Types of Online Food Businesses
Section: 
Subsection: None
Description: SFA regulates all types of food businesses in Singapore, including online food businesses. The online food business sector is diverse.

The businesses can be broadly categorised into three main types: Online food sellers, Organisers of group buys, Food Delivery Services. All types of food businesses, whether online or physical, must comply with prevailing food laws and regulations. This also applies to food businesses that do not require a licence from SFA to operate, such as e-commerce platforms and organisers of group buys. URL: https://www.sfa.gov.sg/food-retail/businesses-that-currently-do-not-need-licence-permit/online-food-businesses/types-of-online-food-businesses

Title: Home-based Food Businesses
Section: 
Subsection: About HDB/URA Home-based Business Scheme
Description: The Home-based Business Scheme enables anyone to run a small-scale business, including a food business, from their home, provided they comply with the requirements and conditions. This scheme allows home-based businesses to operate without requiring approval from the HDB or Urban Redevelopment Authority (URA), provided they meet all the scheme's requirements.
URL: https://www.sfa.gov.sg/food-retail/businesses-that-currently-do-not-need-licence-permit/home-based-food-businesses/about-hdb-ura-home-based-business-scheme

Title: Requirements for Food Delivery Businesses
Section: 
Subsection: None
Description: Food delivery businesses, although not required to obtain a licence from the SFA to operate, still have legal responsibilities and must comply with food safety laws and regulations. URL: https://www.sfa.gov.sg/food-retail/businesses-that-currently-do-not-need-licence-permit/food-delivery-businesses/requirements-for-food-delivery-businesses

Title: Guidelines for Group-Buy Organisers
Section: 
Subsection: None
Description: Group buying is a type of online food business where an organiser buys food in bulk for group members to get lower prices or other perks. Even though you do not need a licence to organise a group buy, you must still comply with the law.

Here is how you can fulfil your legal responsibilities when organising group buys. URL: https://www.sfa.gov.sg/food-retail/businesses-that-currently-do-not-need-licence-permit/group-buy-activities/guidelines-for-group-buy-organisers

Title: Food Shop Licence
Section: 
Subsection: None
Description: For the operation of a food shop where there is retail sale of food and/or beverage. You will need to apply for a Food Shop Licence if you intend to operate a retail food outlet where food and/or drink are sold wholly by retail.

The purpose of licensing is to ensure cleanliness and food safety in food retail outlets and to prevent food-borne diseases. URL: https://www.gobusiness.gov.sg/browse-all-licences/singapore-food-agency-(sfa)/food-shop-licence

Title: Food Stall Licence
Section: 
Subsection: None
Description: For the operation of a foodstall where there is retail sale of food and/or beverage in a foodshop such as private eating houses, coffeeshops, food courts, canteens and private markets. URL: https://www.gobusiness.gov.sg/browse-all-licences/singapore-food-agency-(sfa)/food-stall-licence

Title: Supermarket Licence
Section: 
Subsection: None
Description: For the operation of a supermarket with the sale/preparation of raw food. You will need to apply for a Supermarket Licence if you intend to operate a supermarket with the sale/preparation of raw food. The purpose of licensing is to ensure cleanliness and food safety in supermarkets and to prevent food-borne diseases.
URL: https://www.gobusiness.gov.sg/browse-all-licences/Singapore-Food-Agency-(SFA)/Supermarket-Licence

Title: Permit for Temporary Fair
Section: 
Subsection: None
Description: A temporary set up with makeshift stalls to sell food and or goods. A permit is required from SFA to hold a fair.

The permit will be issued to the operator who manages and operates the fair only after all requirements have been complied with. No fair shall begin operation, unless a permit is issued. The permit is $60, regardless of the duration of the temporary fair. URL: https://www.gobusiness.gov.sg/browse-all-licences/Singapore-Food-Agency-(SFA)/Permit-for-Temporary-Fair

Title: Temporary Fair Stall Licence
Section: 
Subsection: None
Description: This licence is only for stalls within temporary fairs that conduct handling or preparation of food for sale. There is no separate fee for this licence, and it is valid only during the fair duration.
URL: https://www.gobusiness.gov.sg/browse-all-licences/Singapore-Food-Agency-(SFA)/Temporary-Fair-Stall-Licence

Title: Businesses that Need Licence / Registration for Food Manufacturing & Storage
Section: 
Subsection: Licence & Registration
Description: To carry out any food manufacturing or food storage activities in your establishment, you must have a licence/registration from SFA. It is an offence under the prevailing food safety laws to carry out the above activities without a valid SFA licence/registration.
URL: https://www.sfa.gov.sg/food-manufacturing-storage/licence-registration/businesses-that-need-licence-registration-for-food-manufacturing-storage

Title: Licence to Operate a Coldstore
Section: 
Subsection: Licence & Registration
Description: All coldstores for meat and seafood products must be licensed before they store food for wholesale distribution. This licence is for storage only.

There must not be any processing or retail activities. URL: https://www.sfa.gov.sg/food-manufacturing-storage/licence-registration/businesses-that-need-licence-registration-for-food-manufacturing-storage

Title: Licence to Operate a Slaughterhouse
Section: 
Subsection: Licence & Registration
Description: All slaughterhouses for poultry and livestock must be licensed before they slaughter, process, prepare, package, or store food for distribution to wholesalers or retailers. URL: https://www.sfa.gov.sg/food-manufacturing-storage/licence-registration/businesses-that-need-licence-registration-for-food-manufacturing-storage

Title: Registration of Food Storage Warehouses (non-meat/non-fish)
Section: 
Subsection: Licence & Registration
Description: Food storage warehouses are encouraged to register with SFA to facilitate traceability in the event of food recalls. URL: https://www.sfa.gov.sg/food-manufacturing-storage/licence-registration/businesses-that-need-licence-registration-for-food-manufacturing-storage

Title: Application Process & Fees for Licence to Manufacture and Process Animal Feed for Food-Producing Animals
Section: 
Subsection: Licence, Permit & Registration
Description: You must have a SFA licence to manufacture or process animal feed for food-producing animals. This page outlines the main steps involved in the application for a licence.

All local producers of animal feed for food-producing animals must be licensed by SFA before commencing feed production at the approved establishment. The licence is issued with a validity period of 1 year. URL: https://www.sfa.gov.sg/food-manufacturing-storage/licence-registration/application-process-fees-for-licence-to-manufacture-and-process-animal-feed

Title: Licence to Manufacture Animal Feed and Process of Animal Feed for Food Producing Animals
Section: 
Subsection: None
Description: All local commercial producers of animal feed for food producing animals must get a Singapore Food Agency (SFA)â€™s issued licence before they can manufacture and process animal feed. This include livestock feed and aquaculture feed.
URL: https://www.gobusiness.gov.sg/browse-all-licences/Singapore-Food-Agency-(SFA)/Licence-to-Manufacture-Animal-Feed-and-Process-of-Animal-Feed-for-Food-Producing-Animals

Title: Businesses that Need Licence / Registration for Farming
Section: 
Subsection: Licence, Permit & Registration
Description: To carry out farming activities regulated by SFA, you must have the required licence/registration. You will need a licence/registration for the following activities regulated by SFA: operating a land-based farm for commercial production, operating a fish culture farm for commercial production, operating fishing vessels servicing fish culture farms, engaging personnel for activities on fish culture farms.
URL: https://www.sfa.gov.sg/farming/licence-registration/businesses-that-need-licence-registration-for-farming

Title: Fish Culture Farm Licence
Section: 
Subsection: Licence, Permit & Registration
Description: Sea-based fish culture farms for commercial production e.g. fish farms and shrimp farms.
URL: https://www.sfa.gov.sg/farming/licence-registration/businesses-that-need-licence-registration-for-farming

Title: Fishing Vessel Licence
Section: 
Subsection: Licence, Permit & Registration
Description: Servicing fish culture farms. URL: https://www.sfa.gov.sg/farming/licence-registration/businesses-that-need-licence-registration-for-farming

Title: Registration of Personnel on Fish Culture Farms
Section: 
Subsection: Licence, Permit & Registration
Description: All employees and persons engaged in activities on the fish culture farm. URL: https://www.sfa.gov.sg/farming/licence-registration/businesses-that-need-licence-registration-for-farming

Title: Requirements for Pesticide Usage in Farms
Section: 
Subsection: Pesticides
Description: Licensed farms are only permitted to use agricultural pesticides that are registered with SFA. Registered pesticides can only be applied by certified pesticide operators.
URL: https://www.sfa.gov.sg/farming/pesticides/requirements-for-pesticide-usage-in-farms

Title: Businesses that Need Licence / Registration for Fishing Vessel, Gear & Personnel
Section: 
Subsection: None
Description: All inboard fishing vessels and fishing equipment onboard must be licensed by SFA. Individuals employed or engaged in any activity on a fishing vessel must also be registered.

Operating a fishing vessel without a licence is an offence. URL: https://www.sfa.gov.sg/wholesale-markets-fishery-ports/licence-registration/businesses-that-need-licence-registration-for-fishing-vessel-gear-personnel

Title: Health Certificate for Export of Live Foodfish for Breeding
Section: 
Subsection: None
Description: The Health Certificate for Export of Live Foodfish is issued by Singapore Food Agency that allows exporters to export live food fish for farming. With effect from 14 April 2025, exporters are required to install the new Digital Document Reader (DDR) software to preview the watermarked certificates for printing.
URL: https://www.gobusiness.gov.sg/browse-all-licences/singapore-food-agency-(sfa)/health-certificate-for-export-of-live-foodfish-for-breeding

Title: Export Health Certificate
Section: 
Subsection: None
Description: The Export Health Certificate is issued to traders, to certify a food consignment as fit for human consumption, and meeting safety standards or other required criteria to facilitate the export of this food consignment. This certificate is only issued for food consignments manufactured or processed or packed in a food processing establishment licensed by Singapore Food Agency.
URL: https://www.gobusiness.gov.sg/browse-all-licences/singapore-food-agency-(sfa)/export-health-certificate

Title: Free Sale Certificate (Food)
Section: 
Subsection: None
Description: The Free Sale Certificate (Food) allows exporters to get Singapore Food Agency endorsement for their - Meat and Fish products intended for export. - Locally processed meat and fish products intended for export - Processed food products intended for export.

With effect from 14 April 2025, exporters are required to install the new Digital Document Reader (DDR) software to preview the watermarked certificates for printing. URL: https://www.gobusiness.gov.sg/browse-all-licences/singapore-food-agency-(sfa)/free-sale-certificate-(food)

Title: Free Sale Certificate (Animal Feed) for Food Producing Animals
Section: 
Subsection: None
Description: The Free Sale Certificate for Animal Feed will be issued by the Singapore Food Agency. This certificate allows exporters to get endorsement for these animal feed products intended for export.
URL: https://www.gobusiness.gov.sg/browse-all-licences/Singapore-Food-Agency-(SFA)/Free-Sale-Certificate-(Animal-Feed)-for-Food-Producing-Animals

Title: Veterinary Certificate for Food Producing Animals
Section: 
Subsection: None
Description: The Veterinary Certificate will be issued by the Singapore Food Agency. This certificate allows exporters to get endorsement for certification of health and/or testing of the animals for diseases required by the destination country/region.
URL: https://www.gobusiness.gov.sg/browse-all-licences/Singapore-Food-Agency-(SFA)/Veterinary-Certificate-for-Food-Producing-Animals

Title: Submission Form for Food Safety Management System
Section: 
Subsection: None
Description: Submission Form for Food Safety Management System
URL: https://www.gobusiness.gov.sg/browse-all-licences/Singapore-Food-Agency-(SFA)/Submission-Form-for-Food-Safety-Management-System

Title: Understanding the Food Safety Management System (FSMS)
Section: 
Subsection: None
Description: The FSMS helps food businesses ensure the food they provide is safe for consumption. It is a pre-emptive approach for identifying, preventing, and reducing food-borne hazards.
URL: https://www.sfa.gov.sg/regulatory-standards-frameworks-guidelines/food-safety-management/understanding-food-safety-management-system-fsms

Title: Apply for Liquor Licence
Section: 
Subsection: None
Description: A liquor licence is required if your company/business/society intends to supply any liquor, unless otherwise exempted under the Liquor Control (Supply and Consumption) Act 2015 section 4(2). URL: https://www.police.gov.sg/E-Services/Apply-for-Liquor-Licence

Title: Goods Vehicle and Engineering Plant Registration
Section: 
Subsection: None
Description: All vehicles in Singapore, including goods vehicles and engineering plants, must be registered before they can be used or driven on public roads. However, not all registered engineering plants are allowed on public roads.
URL: https://onemotoring.lta.gov.sg/content/onemotoring/home/buying/vehicle-types-and-registrations/commercial-vehicle/goods-vehicle-and-engineering-plant.html

Title: Becoming a Hawker
Section: 
Subsection: None
Description: Everything you need to know about the regulatory requirements of hawker business. NEA will assist stallholders to apply for their Food Stall Licence as part of tenancy administration.

However, if you are a stallholder operating within centres/markets that have the tenancies managed by NEA-appointed Operators, you will need to submit a Food Stall Licence application to SFA. URL: https://www.nea.gov.sg/our-services/hawker-management/becoming-a-hawker

Title: Tobacco Retail Licence
Section: 
Subsection: None
Description: A tobacco retail licence is issued specifically to a particular outlet. If you operate more than one outlet, please make a separate application for each outlet.

You are allowed to start retail sales when your licence application is approved. Licences are non-transferrable between companies / outlets. URL: https://www.hsa.gov.sg/tobacco-regulation/licences/retail/apply
